Description: The Rest on the Flight into Egypt, after Cesare Nebbia; the Virgin and Child seated at left foreground, an angel appearing above Joseph, showing a scene at top left with the family travelling by donkey Pen and brown ink, with brown wash, over black chalk Verso: Nude figure Black chalk
Curator's comments: After Nebbia painting in S Maria dei Monti, Rome. Lit: J.A. Gere and P. Pouncey, 'Italian drawings in the BM, Artists working in Rome', London, 1983, no. 387
Bibliographic references: Gere & Pouncey 1983 / Artists Working in Rome c.1550-c.1640 (387)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: John MacGowan (L.1496, T. Philipe, 28.i.1804/336 as Francesco Landriani 'The Angel appearing to Joseph in a dream, warning him to fly into Egypt, masterly pen, and bistre')
